subject: FW: ask.london2012.com issue

comments.value:
This is from code on the 'about us' page, and probably also in the header where the 'ask a question' link is!
________________________________________
From: Alastair Taylor [alastair@synthetix.com]
Sent: 10 June 2010 09:41
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: FW: ask.london2012.com issue

Hi Liz,

We have spotted a small problem with the way the smartAgent is launched from your website. I gather this is due to the code used to pop it up.

If you see the email below it explains the problem and how to solve it.

I hope this is OK and if you need anyone to talk it through please let me know.

Kind regards

Alastair

-----Original Message-----
From: Peter McKean [mailto:peter@synthetix.com]
Sent: 09 June 2010 18:31
To: Alastair Taylor
Cc: alan@synthetix.com
Subject: ask.london2012.com issue

Alastair,

I'm seeing an issue with ask.london2012.com related to the frameset that LOCOG have put in place to direct the popup window to http://london2012.smartagent.co.uk/.

Using the agent normally can cause horizontal and vertical scrollbars to appear on the screen, obscuring part of the interface.

To stop this, LOCOG need to replace this code on their server:

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>ask.london2012.com</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<FRAMESET ROWS="*,0">
<FRAME SRC="http://london2012.smartagent.co.uk/" NORESIZE>
<NOFRAMES>
Your browser does not support frames.
</NOFRAMES>
</FRAMESET>
</HTML>

...with...

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>ask.london2012.com</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<FRAMESET ROWS="*,0" FRAMEBORDER="0" BORDER="0" FRAMESPACING="0">
<FRAME SRC="http://london2012.smartagent.co.uk/" NORESIZE SCROLLING="NO">
<NOFRAMES>
Your browser does not support frames.
</NOFRAMES>
</FRAMESET>
</HTML>

I've tested this on our systems and it works fine.

Peter.
Hi Liz, We don't host ask.london2012.com ? We just pop a window open to it Ask a question Jamie

Hm, Valid point. You can tell I'm in the midst of a massive email overload. I'll follow up with them!
________________________________________
Marking as solved

subject: Inspire flash promo

comments.value:
Hello

I have updated the scrolling Flash promo on the INspire hub page with a new image (id=8, photo=nicki). I have published the image, the xml and the hub page, but this new pic does not appearing - can you advise what I am doing wrong please? Thanks!

Hi Morag, there's a second xml file in the flash/images folder. I've updated this one and published them, now it seems to work. The flash animation awkwardly seems to require both files to be the same!
Ah, that makes sense. Thank you so much!
Hello, sorry to be a pain but I still can't see this update on the live site. I don't think it's caching on our network - can you see it?

Hi Morag,

Is this still an issue for you?

It should just be this file you need to update, I added an extra full stop to the end of the first line to test (I added a .-) to the end of the other xml file (not sure why we have two fairly sure the one in images is unused)
http://btweb1.london2012.com/get-involved/inspire-programme/flash/xml/textcopy.xml

And after a small wait (publication + the sync across 6 servers can take anything up to 15 mins now) the above change appeared on the live site on the hub page (I have now reverted it).

I wonder if your connection has a proxy cache, which is a bit over zealous in it's cache settings, I know you also have issues with Fash files for a similar reason so maybe it also caches XML files. Try alt-reloading and see if that helps.

Jamie

Hi Jamie,

Thank you – this now works!

It could be network caching – it’s always hard to tell!

Morag

subject: ITS: Feedback on server environment for volunteering site

comments.value: [see recent email correspondence - danny]

Hi Jag,

Please find attached a diagram (attached) illustrating how I saw the new staging servers fitting in (btw. I have no strong preference to them being used this way, this just what I sort of expected based on previous emails)

I realise that one of the main criteria you are hoping to use it for is testing of the load balancers and Apache configs (which will be immensely useful) and therefore you possibly weren't seeing them as part of the live (everyday) publication workflow, maybe you were? once again happy to use them either way.

Obviously if we have a static / self contained website it is very easy to just place it on the staging servers, see if it works and then copy it across to the live servers if it does.

However when we have a new section of the main site (like /get-involved/volunteering) that is intrinsically tied to other pages on the main site / shares components with the live CMS and utilises feeds running on the live CMS it is not quite so simple to separate out the site to a separate server.

The approach I have outlined in the diagram below (and in my email last week) re-routes the current publication from "CMS to web01" to "CMS to staging server01" this gives us an opportunity to limit the RSYNC (completely, by file type or by section) between the staging environment and web01 and therefore view the site on the staging servers first.

The downside of this approach is that staging 01 and 02 become part of the publication workflow and therefore if they are unavailable publication will break.

A complete shutdown of the rsync will also hold up everyday editorial publication, therefore I suggest we look at an intelligent way of limiting what is automatically rynced and what has to be pushed by hand.

I think we probably also need to decide which of these the new servers is really (or most importantly) for:

- testing out config changes to Apache and/or the load balancer and Akamai
- testing out standalone new sites
- a real time mirror of the live environment that all changes have first to pass though (question around delays to editorial publication and how we deal with these)
- limiting the automatic syncing to the live environment of certain kinds of global files (css / js etc.)
- limiting the automatic syncing to the live environment of certain sections
- limiting the automatic syncing to the live environment  completely in the case of a relaunch (question around delays to editorial publication and how we deal with these)

The one big question that needs clarifying I think is whether we expect these servers to be part of the live everyday production workflow (if they are, we can't just turn them off / reboot them at will) or do they simply hold a 'clone' of the existing published site (ie. whatever is on web01 although that does imply they are only useful for testing config changes and not 'staging').

I have included on the diagram our existing / internal dev/staging environment for completeness, what is important to note here is that the editorial content on this server is not the same as the live content, it is a periodic clone of the content held in the CMS, which makes it useful for development/testing but not for handling a real time staging->production workflow. 

Jamie

description: [see recent email correspondence - danny]

subject: Webcams grey screen

comments.value:
Hi

 

Please could you look into why the webcams keep having a grey screen
every now and again? The image is obviously not loading properly but it
seems to happen to one camera at least once a week and doesn't look
good.

 

Thanks

 

Alex

 

  

Alexandra Brown

Marketing Executive (New Media)

Communications

 

Olympic Delivery Authority

Mailpoint: 7A

23rd Floor, One Churchill Place

London E14 5LN

 

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001

www.london2012.com  

 

 

Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com
i'm having a look!

This is fixed ~ And i hope it will not reoccur. 

I changed the feed slightly.. Currently it stopped processing if it hit a broken image on siteeyelive's site but now
it will carry on and ignore the broken image...
Great, thanks!

Hi Lars

 

This has happened again!

 

Can you look into?

 

Thanks

 

Alex

 

 

 

 

 

 

________________________________
I'm monitoring this a little to figure out why this happens.

Hi Lars

 

It’s happened again this morning on two cameras. See image below:

 

Alex

(technote) It looks as if the content we're retrieving from siteeyelive is occasionally being truncated. This is probably because the http request times out, which is interpreted by java as meaning "the content has ended" rather than (more correctly) "an error has occurred". The reason for the timeout is unknown. However, I've put in place a check, so that we should no longer upload such images into the cms. it is pending a code-deployment to the live servers. I'm provisionally scheduling this for Monday evening.

Have upped time from 0.5 days -> 1 day in order to bill for the time that will be spent deploying this code bundle to the live cms. Note that this extra time is strictly related just to this ticket. It should - in effect - be shared across all recent tickets that required code amendments.
have reduced actual days to reflect the fact that the code deployment took less time than expected.

subject: managing the sites in the header dropdown

comments.value:
Can you please look at all of this and make sure it's sensible and fairly easy to achieve? Liz Goulding New Media Producer London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 www.london2012.com www.twitter.com/london2012 -----Original Message----- From: Martin Edwards [mailto:martined@cogapp.com] Sent: 31 March 2010 16:48 To: Liz Goulding Cc: Rachael Rainbow; Jamie Unwin Subject: Success! We now have one solution for ANY domain. Hi Liz, I just tested one new solution and it worked first time, with the added bonus that it's all much simpler as well. No PHP needed. 2 files are attached: - links-list.js: Liz, this is the JSON formatted file where you will be managing the links, please take a look and let me know if it makes sense. The # should be replaced with the microsite link. - theming.js: Jamie, Check the "Some techie info for Jamie" section below for the changes I've made to this file. So: - The JavaScript calls a file on another domain. - This cross domain file is the JSON content (which you will need to edit to add the drop down menu links) wrapped in a *JavaScript function. - Once the cross domain file is returned, our local JavaScript uses its JSON content to populate the HTML drop down. Job done! I hope that makes sense. *For some reason calling the JSON content didn't work cross domain, but calling a JavaScript function does. So we simply wrap the JSON in a JavaScript function Some techie info for Jamie. The microsite content I delivered contained this code below (which linked to a PHP script): $.getJSON("../includes/cross-domain.php", function(data){ $.each(data.links.link, function(){ $("div.drop-down ul").append('
  • ' + $(this).attr("name") + '
    • '); }); }); That should be changed to this one line (replacing the URL with the final LOCOG location): $.getJSON("http://www.cogapp.com/temp/locog/json/links-list.js?callback= ?"); In the cross domain JavaScript file (attached) you'll see we've wrapped the JSON content in a JavaScript function "linkData":
    The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 This E-mail is confidential. If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return E-mail. Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order. Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions. http://www.london2012.com

Liz,

Do you want us to put the header live then?

Jamie

Can I see it first? And have you managed to integrate the new xml file,
etc?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________
I've started working on it - will let you know when it's in preview, should by end of play today.

Liz,

We're trying to figure out what's the best way to implement cogapps idea, it looks hopeful. But to move forward, we'd need the current list of site names + urls we want to show. Can you please confirm / fill the urls?

Shop
http://www.london2012.com/shop/

Tickets
http://www.tickets.london2012.com/

Torch relay
Mascot
Get Set
Volunteering
My2012

Many thanks.

Well, I think we only have those two and Get Set right now!
(getset.london2012.com) We *will* have mascot in 5 weeks or so - maybe
we should actually hold off launching this until then. I don't actually
know what the url of that is yet (it's still TBD but I'll let you know
asap)

 

That said, isn't it going to be quite easy for me to just go in and
add/change urls as/when the come on board?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Liz,

It's on preview http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/index.php - we could as well hide it for five weeks, but probably it's easier to show the functionality. Can you please confirm if/when it can go live?

> That said, isn't it going to be quite easy for me to just go in and add/change urls as/when the come on board?
We can do two things -
a) have a javascript file as cogapp laid out - it would mean we'd have to upload a new sites.js each time we're changing the menu. I'm not sure how often are we planning to change, if that's once a month or less often, it's a perfectly working solution.

b) have a 'did you know'-like interface in the page editor (so all you have to do is edit the links and titles it in the cms). This would turn into a javascript file as published. This solution involves a bit of extra work, half a day, day, so probably has to be authorised.

I think it should go live in line with the mascot launching - mid mad.
Is that ok?

 

We would definitely only want to change it once a month or less. Once
we've got the main sites up there, we won't need to maintain regularly

 

Is it possible for me to change the javascript file myself? Or will it
need to go through you? And if it does go through you, how much time
will it take (presumably like 15 mins?). Probably not worth the 'did
you know' style interface...

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Liz,

just to answer your question about javascript:

It's probably not a good idea for you to update the javascript and certainly not without testing it on dev first--unless you really want to take responsibility for this sort of thing. I think your estimate or 15 mins to update the file is plausible, although we would almost certainly want to allow more time given that we will want to implement and test it on dev first before doing the same on live. It's probably not worth an interface, I think (although if you were changing it every other week, there might be a case for it...).

I've set this to pending, awaiting confirmation of a date for putting this live.

Mascot is launching the evening of the 19th. So ideally we put it live that evening, but given we've only just confirmed the evening launch, if it's not something you can commit to, then first thing on the 20th.

Also, we will be putting this dropdown on the mascot site, so I think there is a central file that will need to be updated so that the mascot site has access to it. I can get Cogapp to explain further, but I *think* MArtin sent Jamie an email on this a month or 6 weeks back. Can you confirm?


 _____

Liz, I can confirm we can produce a js file, given we've got confirmation for the following two things:

- from Liz: the items we want to put the drop-down menu, in the correct order (currently: shop, tickets, get set - I guess mascot should be added and not entirely sure how one gets back from the mascot site to the main 2012 site, so probably "main site", "shop", "tickets", "get set", "mascot")

- from cogapp, a confirmation that this is the jsonp format that they want: http://www.cogapp.com/temp/locog/json/links-list.js and if they're happy with a FIXED (linkData) callback function. It'll probably sit on http://www.london2012.com/js/linkdata.js - nothing there yet at the moment, but will put a file there in an hour.
Liz,  http://www.london2012.com/js/linkdata.js is there, i hope cogapp can get back if they're happy with it.
Marking as solved

description:
Can you please look at all of this and make sure it's sensible and fairly easy to achieve? Liz Goulding New Media Producer London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 www.london2012.com www.twitter.com/london2012 -----Original Message----- From: Martin Edwards [mailto:martined@cogapp.com] Sent: 31 March 2010 16:48 To: Liz Goulding Cc: Rachael Rainbow; Jamie Unwin Subject: Success! We now have one solution for ANY domain. Hi Liz, I just tested one new solution and it worked first time, with the added bonus that it's all much simpler as well. No PHP needed. 2 files are attached: - links-list.js: Liz, this is the JSON formatted file where you will be managing the links, please take a look and let me know if it makes sense. The # should be replaced with the microsite link. - theming.js: Jamie, Check the "Some techie info for Jamie" section below for the changes I've made to this file. So: - The JavaScript calls a file on another domain. - This cross domain file is the JSON content (which you will need to edit to add the drop down menu links) wrapped in a *JavaScript function. - Once the cross domain file is returned, our local JavaScript uses its JSON content to populate the HTML drop down. Job done! I hope that makes sense. *For some reason calling the JSON content didn't work cross domain, but calling a JavaScript function does. So we simply wrap the JSON in a JavaScript function Some techie info for Jamie. The microsite content I delivered contained this code below (which linked to a PHP script): $.getJSON("../includes/cross-domain.php", function(data){ $.each(data.links.link, function(){ $("div.drop-down ul").append('
  • ' + $(this).attr("name") + '
    • '); }); }); That should be changed to this one line (replacing the URL with the final LOCOG location): $.getJSON("http://www.cogapp.com/temp/locog/json/links-list.js?callback= ?"); In the cross domain JavaScript file (attached) you'll see we've wrapped the JSON content in a JavaScript function "linkData":
    The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 This E-mail is confidential. If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return E-mail. Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order. subject: Volunteering site-editorial handover

comments.value: Required for testing mid-May.

Hi Morag/Liz,

Haven't heard anything back from McCann on this?

Do you have a spec / date for delivery of designs?

thanks

Jamie

Sorry for not updating you on this before now. We are at design stage and it would be timely to have a call with you to share the designs with you and discuss implementation and timelines. The drop-dead date for having the populated pages ready for testing is 8 June, so we need to work back from that. Will try to put a time in the diary this week for a call / meeting with McCann. Thanks!
Just putting a comment on this to push it to the top of our radar (I know Jamie and Morag have already been discussing it).
Liz, The date on this needs to be rescheduled. Can we discuss?
Morag is the one to speak to here.

Concerned that the date for this is being pushed back, as this is a very firm deadline for us. Can we discuss the order in which we handle these templates so we can get the content into the site in time? Also, can you confirm the date you think you are working to? Mid-May (at the top of the ticket) is not the actual date - we need to have the site up and populated and running on the staging environment by 7 June - so there is possibly more time, although that eats into the time we have available to add content. Let's discuss today in our catch-up.
Discussed. Date for delivery now changed to May 31st.
We are currently looking at about 20 days for this, not including registration work (separate ticket)
Thanks for this – it sounds in order. Please note: a separate PO will be provided for this piece of work so please keep separate from the retainer.
We have marked this as solved (i.e. editorial handover). We can open new tickets for new issues or additional work.
Perfect – thanks!

description: Required for testing mid-May.

subject: Issue with blog name

comments.value:
Hi,

Just wanted to report an issue with naming blogs. Once a blog has been named, it is extremely difficult to change that name, even if you change it in the text field and re-save it. I thought I had succeeded yesterday in changing the name (from 'How I was knocked out by boxing' to 'Knocked out by boxing') - but then found the page name remained 'How I was knocked out by boxing' (see below).

Kathryn

subject: Publishing 'francais' link in global nav

comments.value:
Hello

Have noticed that the 'francais' link in the top nav is only appearing on some pages e.g. it's not there on the hubs for 'Get involved now' or 'Making it happen'. I suspect that the whole site might need republishing - is that the case, and should I try to do it myself or could we schedule a global publish tonight so the top nav is updated?

Hi Morag,

Actually those pages appear different in preview as well, I wonder if they use a different header component, checking now.

Jamie

Hi Morag,

Ah figured it out..

It's because those pages don't have french versions.

Here is the complete list..

Jamie 

var blacklistedPaths = [
 "blog/",
 "get-involved/business-network/",
 "get-involved/cultural-olympiad/",
 "get-involved/education/",
 "get-involved/inspire-programme/",
 "get-involved/live-sites/",
 "get-involved/open-weekend/",
 "get-involved/volunteering/",
 "jobs/",
 "making-it-happen/art-on-the-olympic-park/",
 "making-it-happen/living-near-the-olympic-park/",
 "publications/",
 "videos/",
 "virtual-tours/",
 "index.php"
 ];
But something like ‘Making it happen’ hub doesn’t have francais on it, and that page certainly has a French equivalent
fixed. The site doesn't need republishing. There was just a problem with three pages (which I've fixed, republished, etc.) Kieran.
Thank you, Kieran – looks great

subject: Change of email address on Contact us page - urgent

comments.value:
Hello

As of today we have a new Call Centre going live which will be processing all the public enquiries. This is run by a third party operator. 

Consequently we need to update the Contact us page so that any public enquiries directed to LOCOG will be forwarded directly to info@enquiries.london2012.com instead of enquiries@london2012.com 

Any questions in the drop down which relate to the ODA will not change their email address i.e. they continue to be directed to the existing email address.

Is it possible to set up this change asap today so that we have a smooth transfer to the new call centre provider?

Happy to answer questions. Many thanks!!
Priority changed to "urgent".

Hi Morag,

Have updated, but for future reference you can do it here yourself, may need to republish contact page after saving.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/emailContacts

Jamie

That’s quite remarkable – I had no idea we could control that.

Thanks very much!
I don’t seem to have access to this through my CMS view – should it be in the Data tab?
I dont' think it's currently linked to from anywhere in the CMS
Cool

description:
Hello

As of today we have a new Call Centre going live which will be processing all the public enquiries. This is run by a third party operator. 

Consequently we need to update the Contact us page so that any public enquiries directed to LOCOG will be forwarded directly to info@enquiries.london2012.com instead of enquiries@london2012.com 

Any questions in the drop down which relate to the ODA will not change their email address i.e. they continue to be directed to the existing email address.

Is it possible to set up this change asap today so that we have a smooth transfer to the new call centre provider?

Happy to answer questions. Many thanks!!

comments.value:

Sent: 13 May 2010 13:59
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: CMS download

HI Liz,

We are getting funny characters again when downloading from CMS this hasn’t happened for a while but seems to have started again this week, the one that keeps popping up is â€™ in place of a ‘  not sure why it’s started up again but thought I would flag it.

R

Ruth Langford-Johnson
Open Weekend Project Coordinator
Culture, Ceremonies, Education & Livesites
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 169

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
london2012.com


P Please consider the environment before printing this email

Hello Liz,
I'd like to fix this - if it's still a problem.
Do you have any more information about how reproducible it is, or which pages it appears on?
Thanks,
Kieran
Well it would definitely be on the Open weekend event submission form. I haven’t heard of any more problems, but if you can have a go at replicating i would appreciate it.

When you're opening the open weekend download in (presumably?) Excel, are you telling excel that the "character set" or "character encoding" is "utf-8" ?
My guess is that you might not be, in which case this is why the Windows curly left & right single & double quotes appear strange.
I would also expect you to be seeing "Â£2000" instead of "£2000" - is that the case?

When you're opening the open weekend download in (presumably?) Excel, are you telling excel that the "character set" or "character encoding" is "utf-8" ?
My guess is that you might not be, in which case this is why the Windows curly left & right single & double quotes appear strange.
I would also expect you to be seeing "Â£2000" instead of "£2000" - is that the case?

I’ll need to double check with the team. That’s not the problem being referred to in this ticket, though! This is when an organisation actually goes onto the web form to submit an event. After hitting the ‘submit’ button, the page just goes completely blank (and it doesn’t actually get submitted). Can you please check that?

Erm, maybe I'm getting confused, but I /think/ there is another ticket for that problem, which Janos is investigating: http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/932

/This/ ticket is specifically about the strange characters appearing in the downloaded csv file containing the open weekend events.

I appreciate it's probably lower priority than the other ticket though, so feel free to reply/investigate whenever you get time (or - indeed - to correct me if I'm wrong!)

Many thanks,
Kieran

Jeez – you’re right, Kieran! I skim read and made the wrong assumption! I think we are ok on the weird characters during export. And I’ll re-confrim the utf-8 note.

Go ahead and close this ticket!

Liz

Thanks,

Sutveer

[cid:image005.jpg@01CAFDB6.E6AEEFE0][cid:image006.jpg@01CAFDB6.E6AEEFE0]

Hi Sutveer,

I think the problem is that the image is being 'blown up' on the news page and hence the pixelation.

Blog (440 pixels wide)
http://www.london2012.com/images/events/jonathan-edwards-launches-let-s-get-cooking-around-the-world.gif
http://www.london2012.com/blog/2010/05/inspiring-children-to-cook-and-learn-languages.php

News (stretched to 460 pixels wide)
http://www.london2012.com/transform/2892437/m460x/jonathan-edwards-launches-let-s-get-cooking-around-the-world.gif
http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/05/jonathan-edwards-declares-cooking-and-languages-a-recipe-for-success.php

If you already have an image that is 460px wide or bigger (it will get reduced down to fit) then it would be better to use that. Did this image come from Getty?

Otherwise I have attached a 460px wide version which I 'blew up' in Photoshop which doesn't suffer so badly from the pixelation.

Jamie

description:
Hello, we are using the same picture for a news story and the blog... do you know why the one on the news story is coming up as pixalated?

Thanks,

Sutveer

[cid:image005.jpg@01CAFDB6.E6AEEFE0][cid:image006.jpg@01CAFDB6.E6AEEFE0]

subject: Open weekend event pages - display information

comments.value:
I could have sworn this was already in here - but I can't find it!  On the listings pages we need the information below, in that order.  Right now I think you might have the short and long descriptions backwards, when I look in preview?  And we don't need organisation on there.

1.	Event name
2.	Short description
3.      Picture
4.	Challenge (displayed in a very obvious way! -- I recognize you aren't designers, but if this can stand out in some way - bold/pink? that would be excellent)
5.      Type of event
6.	Long Description (this might be best suited to being at the end)
7.	Dates
8.	Timings
9.	Ticketing
10.	Venue Address & Post Code
11.	Accessible info
12.	Website

I'm about to go on holiday.  When this is done, can you please get a screenshot through to openweekend@london2012.com so they can see what it looks like?  Finn/Morag will also be able to help.

Can I just clarify your happy with us modifying the standard event 
page so it looks like below for *all* events, at least for the period 
leading up to the OW.

Obviously unused fields will just be hidden.

* we could look at making a separate set of OW event pages or 
adjusting the format depending on the type of event but that may just 
add confusion in the short term (given that 90% of events on the site 
over the next month I assume will be OW ones)

Fine to change it for all of them - obviously the 'challenge' field will be empty!
________________________________

OK thanks for the clarification,

Will do !
screen shot attached (I have highlighted the description field in the screenshot, rather than the challenge field, but the challange is the one that will be highlighted once this goes live)
Correct screen shot attached, awaiting sign off by OW team.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/events/uncovering-the-wyre-forest.php

subject: image naming

comments.value:
Hi
We sent a picture through from Getty and not sure why the wrong title came up for it - in getty, it's not 'A human Torch', never was. We're not sure where that came from.

I've since changed it in the CMS so i'm not sure whether or not you'll be able to work out what's happened, but if you could let us know (possibly something to do with the photographer's original metadata??) it would be really useful.

thanks

[cid:image001.png@01CAFCEA.827D7F90]

Deborah Elstein
Copywriter
Communications and Public Affairs
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 109

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
london2012.com


P Please consider the environment before printing this email

Thanks for spotting this Debs

Think this came from the photographer and I didn't spot in Getty.

Amy

There is a field called "CMS title" which is different from the name 
in Getty

Could that have been left empty or fille din wrong?

Any idea what 'A human Torch' refers to, could it have been some other 
meta data field on that image (I'm thinking we may have fallen back to 
another field if the 'CMS title' was missing) or was it another image 
that came over just before it?

We haven't changed anything re. the Getty feed or image lately so 
woudl be surprised if something had just broken' recently.
